This might change the [ABI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Application_binary_interface), depending on whether or not this class is considered part of the public API. If it’s part of the API, then we may need to see about using a different implementation. 

Is this part of the following bullet point?

> Allow Skeleton to store data of raw node weights with multiple vertices group. The raw node weights are overwritten when loading a new submesh, while not strictly required becauses submeshes are load sequentially, it is probably more "correct" to have the full node weights available.

If so, then we can just consider reverting to the old implementation if adding this member field impacts the ABI and doesn’t offer any functional difference to the end user.

This might change the ABI, depending on whether or not this class is considered part of the public API. If it’s part of the API, then we may need to see about using a different implementation.

Is this part of the following bullet point?

Allow Skeleton to store data of raw node weights with multiple vertices group. The raw node weights are overwritten when loading a new submesh, while not strictly required becauses submeshes are load sequentially, it is probably more "correct" to have the full node weights available.

If so, then we can just consider reverting to the old implementation if adding this member field impacts the ABI and doesn’t offer any functional difference to the end user.
